pullRequest.body:
Merge `Init.Order.Lemmas` and the part of `Init.Algebra.Classes` about relations into `Order.Defs`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #16022
- [x] depends on: #16059

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4177 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 174139 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (priority := 100) (Î± : Sort u) (lt : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsStrictWeakOrder Î± lt] :`
`+ instance (priority := 100) IsAsymm.toIsAntisymm {Î± : Sort*} (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsAsymm Î± r] :`
`+ instance (priority := 100) {Î± : Sort*} {r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop} [Trans r r r] : IsTrans Î± r`

  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Well at least @digama0 wrote in the header of this file that a rework was needed ðŸ¤· 

The point of my strategy here is to ensure nothing was lost.
You have a merge conflict; can you merge master, please? Thanks!
@Vierkantor offered to do it, but looks like they're on holiday. Will do it tomorrow evening if they don't beat me to it

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16022~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16059~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
@jcommelin I am surprised bors goes forward with changes requested.
That looks surprising indeed. Perhaps because the commented lines are now "outdated" (for github's, but perhaps also bors' purposes)?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10524056557/job/29160036690)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10524056557/job/29160036493)
We should not move code and reformat it at the same time; this makes review impossible. (I also don't think there's consensus we should go around reformatting code anyway.)

YaÃ«l, I'm appreciative of all the work you do cleaning up these low-level files, but this diff is very difficult to review as-is. There's a ton of noise. You're doing a split / move of multiple files into one, golfing proofs, changing aesthetic-only choices, making stylistic changes (where the previous style wasn't actually wrong according the style guide), adding `deprecation` tags, and maybe more, I'm not sure (because it's too hard to figure out).

Can you please split this into more manageable chunks?
We should not move code and reformat it at the same time; this makes review impossible. (I also don't think there's consensus we should go around reformatting code anyway.)

YaÃ«l, I'm appreciative of all the work you do cleaning up these low-level files, but this diff is very difficult to review as-is. There's a ton of noise. You're doing a split / move of multiple files into one, golfing proofs, changing aesthetic-only choices, making stylistic changes (where the previous style wasn't actually wrong according the style guide), adding `deprecation` tags, and maybe more, I'm not sure (because it's too hard to figure out).

Can you please split this into more manageable chunks?
If you want to remove random theorems, please do that in a separate PR, after they've been deprecated for a while
This one is a useless combination of other lemmas and uses are anecdotic. Am happy to see it restored deprecated, though
It doesn't make sense to me to create a *new* file in `Init`, especially since everything here is `deprecated`. Can you move this stuff to `Deprecated` instead?
why is code reformatting part of this PR? This is just noise in the diff.
It wasn't showing in the diff before #15210 was merged...
Actually wait no that's not code reformatting at all. That's necessary because of the argument changes to `irrefl` and `trans`
Lots of things have been deprecated in this PR, with no explanation in the description as to the reasons. Even if they are the right choices, it's hard to understand why in all cases.

I am deprecating all the classes that mathlib is not using. This is a long standing TODO in those Init files: Deciding what's useful and what's not. If you scroll up a bit, you will see that Mario has written a fairly detailed list of all those classes, with hints to which ones are useful to keep and which ones are not
Why the change from `Type u` to `Type*`? Seems just aesthetic.
I understand the desire to simplify code by pulling out variables, but this just increases the diff and makes review harder.
Again, wasn't showing in the diff before #15210
Again, this is just an aesthetic change and makes it harder to understand what's happening.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Init/Order): Rework files
